description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONThe AWS Analytics team designs and delivers the next generation suite of business analytics tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Amazon FinSpace, and AWS Glue Databrew. We empower technical and non-technical users in every industry with “low-code” and “no-code” analytics solutions. We constantly innovate ways to deliver faster, more intuitive, and more actionable insights at a massive scale. We are re-inventing business intelligence with the goal of allowing everyone to make data-driven decisions. Our customers include startups and Fortune 500 companies.To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Visual Designer to be the key voice in defining the brand identity and visual language of our enterprise-class application through UI, art direction, graphic design, and motion design.Key job responsibilitiesYou will be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers harness the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. You will have a significant impact on our business as you take a leadership role in setting the creative strategy for this new collection of products and services.You will also drive our creative strategy by working with key stakeholders to prioritize and maximize resources, scoping projects, and communicating trade-offs when appropriate. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, and design technologists who seek to harness the power of the AWS cloud into an everyday tool for data management, analysis and collaboration through a human-centered design process.A day in the lifeThe ideal candidate will thrive in collaboration with UX designers, product managers, marketing managers, and other visual designers to create and maintain a cohesive visual identity for our new service across all customer touch-points. You are a problem solver with strong bias for action, always ready to be hands-on to visualize solutions. You take a customer-centered approach to define how visual design works across contexts, devices and domains, while being able to dive deep into identity, layout, typography, UI, motion design, and other components of visual brand expression. You proactively work on behalf of the team to create clarity in the face of ambiguity.Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional experience as a UI designer or interaction designer, visual designer, creative director, art director, or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices. Experience working in a product lifecycle with front-end and back-end engineering teams. Estimate, organize, and track components within an atomic design system. Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in graphic design or related field or equivalent professional experience within a design fieldPreferred Qualifications Exceptional creative concepting, development, and design skills, Experience creating brand guidelines and UX design systems Deep understanding of typography, design principles, trends and best practices across enterprise software Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business and user interaction priorities A self-starter with the ability to navigate ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment An understanding of how to advocate for customers and integrate user research in the creative process Curiosity to dig several layers deep into success metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers Basic knowledge of UX and front-end web design processes and accessibility standardsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon Dev Center U.S., Inc.Job ID: A1905213 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

Direct message the job poster from Portfolio Creative Jamie Wells Business Development Manager at Portfolio Creative ABOUT OUR CLIENT:Award-winning creative studio based proudly in downtown Columbus, Ohio.Founders started the company in 2011 on the belief that a smaller, focused team can deliver a more powerful consumer-first, branded experience than most, larger shops.MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS:• 3-5 years of design experience, preferably in interactive/digital• Bachelor's Degree in Design (or a killer portfolio and some serious design-savvy)• Be the lead designer on projects and lead design teams when necessary• Produce concepts from sketch to beautiful and effective digital designs• It is your responsibility to work alongside and help lead 2nd concept designers• You are expected to see website re-designs all the way through A-Z, concept to QA• Create best practice information architecture; sitemaps, wireframes & user flows• Must have the ability to clearly articulate UX/UI reviews internally and to clients• Follow creative direction and client brand guidelines to establish brand language and extension• Collaborate with developers, copywriters, producers, other designers, and interns• Prepare files for print production, HTML, emails, social assets and style guidesBONUS SKILLS:• Motion graphics using After Effects, Cinema 4D, Lottie Files• Photography and Photo editing experience• Video editing experience using Premiere or Final Cut Pro• Illustration using your hands• Javascript or CSS animation experiencePERKS AND BENEFITS:• Health, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance (99% premium paid by the company, 1% paid by employee)• Long-Term Disability (100% premium paid by the company)• 401k with company matching and profit sharing• PTO with holidays + studio shut down at end of year• 4-week sabbatical after your 6th year• Hybrid schedule (WFH Monday / Friday, in studio Tuesday - Thursday)• Macbook Pros on tap• Training + conference opportunities• Casual dog-friendly studio environment• Downtown studio with parking paid for by the company• Summer hours on Fridays (as long as it's warm out and the brews are cold)• Full fridge of impromptu Happy Hour beverages• Catered lunches on Wednesday from Bentos Catering• Coffee roasted by One Line CoffeeVIEW MORE HERE:https://jobs.portfoliocreative.com/jobs/5896 Show more Show less Employment type Full-time

Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONCome be a part of the mission to improve children’s lifelong outcomes by helping them connect with adult loved ones, no matter how near or far. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet.Description of Glow: “A new-to-world virtual, connected, and projected interaction model designed to help children and remote loved ones play, create, read, learn and have fun together as if they are right next to each other.”#GlowCareersWe are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. As an Art Director, you will be working with a collaborative team developing exciting products for consumers.Key job responsibilitiesThis position requires the ability to dive deep, invent, and be relentlessly curious about customer needs and how we can bring potential solutions to life. You will validate concepts at a variety of fidelities, including working prototypes, throughout the design process. You are highly motivated to explore new opportunities along the way, consistently raising the bar for what’s possible. You will be hands-on, designing graphics and UI elements, executing creative direction, establishing procedure, and ensuring visual consistency across our product. Create and rapidly iterate on ideas using storyboards, prototypes, and higher-fidelity designs to effectively communicate visual strategies and experiences Articulately present design vision, direction and solutions to senior leadership and internal stakeholders Fluency in moving from understanding and interpreting strategy to developing initial concepts Participate in the discovery and planning of new products and features while helping drive the design vision across our product suite Work with other UX designers to ensure visual consistency and relentless attention to detail Identify opportunities to think differently about the visual status quo on customer experiences, based on customer research, best practices and design thinkingAbout The TeamWe are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded designers and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Basic Qualifications 4+ years of relevant work experience Bachelors in graphic design, visual design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related field A portfolio of work demonstrating user interface design and design systems across multiple product categories, platforms, and domains. Expert level with standard design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc.Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated ability to learn, evaluate, and adopt new technologies quickly Ability to work with ambiguity and visualize solutions for emerging concepts Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization Exceptional attention to detail Experience designing interfaces for interactive mobile experiences Experience with illustration and motion design Experience working in a start-up style environment, where rapid iteration is encouraged Experience designing products for global markets Experience designing consumer products for children and familiesAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A1911804 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

Mischief or similar suite.• Adobe Creative Cloud – Production (Audition, After Effects, Premiere, Media Encoder) or similar suite for video editing/authoring and creation.• Design principles and/or Human-Centered interaction experience.• Design experience in web/mobile/app/responsive.• Accessibility guidelines knowledge.Qualifications• BS in Industrial Engineering, Information Systems/Software Engineering/Telecommunications Engineering or Digital majors (Graphic Design, Web Design and similar).• 3+ years of experience in a field related to UI Design.• A strong technical, business and/or design background. Starbucks, as a company is all about creating a culture of warmth and belonging, acting with courage, and delivering our very best. We are performance driven, through the lens of humanity. When you work with us, you hold Starbucks legacy. Our mission: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit - one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time. We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about user experience but embodies the Starbucks mission and values.Team DescriptionCome be a part of an innovative Digital Product Design team that believes in digging deeper to figure out how technology should work for our retail partners (employees). We’re looking for a User Experience Designer to join our human centered design team. We are a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by an iterative process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we’re discovering the needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for thousands of store partners.Role DescriptionYou are a driven UX Designer who appreciates simplicity and appealing user experiences.You are passionate about UI and Visual Design/Interaction Design.We have a few projects in the pipeline, and we are tackling our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. There are countless UX challenges and we feel like we are in a unique position to change the way our store partners (employees) interact with digital. You’ll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form the product. You’ll use your full range of skills in user experience to build great products.Responsibilities You're actively involved in defining product strategy. Thinking in terms of human centered design and making rational design decisions. Constantly pushing your limits and searching for opportunities to become better. Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled. You thrive in an environment with short feedback loops. You partner with other designers to elevate the group. You should be comfortable understanding how to do user research to validate your design ideas.Requirements 2+ years professional experience creating and walking stakeholders through user journeys, wires, prototypes, usability studies, and other design deliverables. An understanding of what makes an experience good or bad is critical. You can think through user problems, find reasonable solutions, mock them up in detail, and work with product managers and engineers to build them. You're a self-starter who actively seeks ways to make the Starbucks experience both visually appealing and easy to use. You look for opportunities to solve problems in unusual and innovative ways. You understand the technical limitations and liberties behind your decisions and have enough chops to communicate your ideas to our engineers and the rest of the team. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent practical work experience in User Experience.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com. location: New York, New York, United States
description: This opportunity is to join McCann New York, the flagship office of the global McCann network, as a UI Designer primarily focused on digital projects across many of McCann’s clients. The UI designer will join a team responsible for producing digital and experiential advertising projects. You will partner closely with a UX architect in order to deliver conceptual and production quality user interfaces for both websites and occasionally brand experiences. Responsibilities:· Create conceptual and production quality User Interfaces and digital assets for web, be that components, full pages, user journeys, or entire websites.· Able to work across websites, apps, and interfaces within installations/activations which could vary across the UI/design spectrum.· Design, produce and detail UI assets ready for developer hand-off.· Work with UX consultants to ideate, conceptualize and feed into the UX strategy.· Support the digital team in the discovery phase of projects, assisting with identification of the creative and visual design strategy.· Champion digital creative excellence, upskilling the team and push the boundaries of creative output for the department.· Experience executing interfaces; working within the defined user experience and brand guidelines to fulfil strategic goals translating brand identity across digital touchpoints. About you:· You are highly collaborative and thrive on working in close partnerships with UX consultants and developers to design effective experiences but are equally comfortable working independently on multiple smaller projects.· You will have excellent communication skills visually, verbally and in written format enabling you to convey your design intentions and rationale, whether that be to internal account teams, or with clients.· Proven creative problem solver experienced in dealing with digital channel limitations and marketing requirements. · You will naturally have a high attention to detail with pixel perfect consistency a given, and technical design knowledge including typography, layout principles, mobile and UI best practice, asset optimization, and accessibility considerations.· You will have skills in Adobe Creative Suite and ideally Adobe XD, able to efficiently craft user interfaces, scalable design systems, and create low functional fidelity prototypes. Experience in Sketch, Figma, Axure, ProtoPie or other design and prototyping tools including HTML & CSS would be a bonus.· You will have an excellent UI portfolio that communicates the visual decision-making process you and your team arrived at in response to end user goals and business requirements.· You will be curious about understanding user behavior and the audience you design user interfaces for, with a genuine passion in developing your knowledge of usability and user experience.· You will have a strong interest in digital beyond the web and keep up to date with the latest advancements through active involvement in the design community.· 2+ years of experience as a UI Designer preferred McCann is an EEO M/F/Disability/Vet EmployerParticipant in E-Verify Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Temporary Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Advertising Services

Job TitleUI DesignerRequisition IDR013542Job DescriptionYour Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare.A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter.Your MissionAs a UI Designer you will participate in the creation and maintenance of a functioning, iterative UI pipeline, in collaboration with team members from other disciplines.ResponsibilitiesPriorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilitiesCreate UI layout, script functionality, and animation of UI features.Create and/or integrate assets and test functionality of UI widgets.Work closely with our UI/UX Director, UI Design Lead and other UI/UX Designers on implementing and scrutinizing UI components.Player Profile Experience3+ years developing for PC and console, as well as one shipped title is preferred.Knowledge & SkillsPassionate and knowledgeable about UI and UX, and able to articulate this.Experience with scripting languages (Lua, ActionScript, C#, Python, React JS).Must be proficient in Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator.Key AttributesPassion for games.Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.R013542 Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Computer Games

Idera, Inc. is growing our UX/UI Design team. We are looking for a UX designer who will help improve usability for our DevOp products. You will design across web and desktop enterprise applications, collaborate withDirector of UX/UI Design, Product and Engineering team members, perform user research, and create other UX/UI design deliverables. What You’ll Be Doing:Work on multiple product releases for DevOp products assigned by the Director of UX/UI Design. Work closely with the Dev Design, product managers, architects and developers to improve our DevOp user experiences through research and application of UXD best practices. Perform product UI audits, heuristics, and walkthroughs. Write usability improvement reports with suggested implementation plans Define key interaction models and workflows. Create high-fidelity mockups and prototypes using the existing product design library or stylesheets.Present designs to the product team and be able to intelligently explain design choices based on research and UXD best practices.Write effective user interface design specifications to help development. Create and update existing style guides, component library and other documentationHandoff files to developers using Figma Attend developer demos and install software to ensure designs were implemented correctly. Advocate for UX to be added to releases with product managers.Must Haves: 2 years professional UX/UI Design experience with enterprise applications BA/BS degree with an emphasis in HCI, Human Factors, Interaction Design, or similar Exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills Strong knowledge of user-centered design, UI best practices and design principles (i.e. color theory, Hicks Law, Law of Proximity, etc.) Proven hands-on experience creating mockups, prototypes, user flows, etc. Experience using style guides, common component libraries and Sketch libraries. Advanced knowledge of UX/UI software like Figma Experience working in waterfall Development Cycle and Jira. A thinker that can think through a problem and be self-reliant Be open to receiving objective criticism and improving upon it. Well-Organized and proactive with exceptional attention to detail. Able to juggle multiple tasks and assignments at once. Comfortable working remote while collaborating with global remote product teams at different time zones.Excellent communicator (written and verbal).Preferred skills: Design experience for Enterprise SaaS and desktop applications with data visualization. Basic knowledge of Dev Ops, QA Testing, or Development. Some basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript programming experience.Please note:No Agencies, please!You must include a portfolio link that displays professional “paid” UX/UI projects to be considered for this role.This is not a visual/graphic design or development position.This is an ongoing contract with no end date.You must be able to attend meetings between 8 AM and 11 AM CST, Monday - Friday.You must be fluent in speaking and writing English. description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. At Swimm, our mission is to help engineering teams radically improve their knowledge of the code through continuous and auto-synced documentation. With Swimm, Continuous Documentation becomes an integral part of the development lifecycle, making it a must for organizations that need to scale fast while maintaining the knowledge on their codebase. Swimm’s platform allows engineers to build documentation that includes “live” snippets and tokens from the codebase that auto-sync every time the code changes.Swimm is an early-stage startup eager to make an impact on the developer’s day-to-day experience. In November 2021, Swimm launched its free open beta and announced a $27.6 million Series A funding round; Swimm’s total funding to date is $33.3 million.One of Swimm’s growth pillars is the UI/UX Design position. This role is for someone that aspires to create great products that engineers are excited to use. The UI/UX Designer will join our NYC office and will work directly with the engineering team to create a sleek intuitive product.A Glimpse Into What You Will Be DoingContribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of Swimm’s platform.Understand the core audience (developers) and suggest flows that support these preferences.Create wireframes and mockups and present them to internal stakeholders and teams.Work closely with project manager, design, developers. Stay up to date with the latest UX trends and incorporate them into the product.Manage user testing sessions and translate findings.Support a more holistic approach by providing services to the marketing team.Contribute and maintain the design system.About YouYou are a self-starter You have 2-3 years of UX design experienceAre proficient in FigmaIt Would Be Nice IfHave knowledge of basic programming skillsYou have a background in a startup ecosystem or experience working with developers.Compensation And BenefitsOur Swimmers take care of the business and we take care of them. Swimm works hard to provide our team with a generous benefits package including a base salary plus options in the company because when you join the Swimm team, you are a true partner; 401k, Medical, Dental and Vision coverage, life insurance, flexibile work hours and a hybrid work model, a commuter allowance to get to our NY office, and generous PTO because we know that work/balance is important and we want you to take time off to relax and rejuvenate.Swimm is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We welcome and employ people regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.None Show more Show less Seniority level Entry level Employment type Full-time Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Software Development

Direct message the job poster from Insight Global Vanessa Palmisano Professional Recruiter at Insight Global- I'm Hiring! Must-Haves:Bachelor’s Degree in Art, Visual Communication, Graphic Design, Information Technology or Computer Science or a related field is preferred, but a strong project portfolio trumps all5 years of related work experience in technology/ online lead-gen business Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies Experience designing responsive websites Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps Experience in researching users and conducting usability testingKnowledge of current web standards including best practices for usability and accessibility Technical Skills - Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, etc.), Sketch, Azure, Balsamiq, InVision, Omnigraffle and Axure - Technical experience in Client-side languages and frameworks including HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (e.g. jQuery, Angular, Bootstrap) - Experience with Server-side languages such as Node.js, and PHP - Strong familiarity with Web design patterns and UI toolkits - Git version control Plusses:Experience running A/B testing a plusExperience in automotive is a plus, but not required. A leader in the automotive-retail business, is looking for a highly talented web designer to focus primarily on user interface design and creating state-of-the art and robust user experiences to increase lead conversion rates. The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI and UX skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and graphic components, and transform them into aesthetic, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. As part of an onsite Business Intelligence team, the UX/UI Designer will be working in a collaborative environment. The UX/UI Designer has a broad range of design skills with a passion for and strong experience in front-end design and user experience. The UX/UI Designer should be able to conceive and execute interface solutions for complex data-driven web-based applications that meet user needs. As part of a multidisciplinary team the UX/UI designer will work closely with back-end developers to ensure the integrity of the user experience and user interface throughout the development lifecycle, as well as our product manager, web analyst, and others to create amazing experiences for our end users. This individual will be responsible for brainstorming new concepts and delivering designs and specifications that are not only implementation-ready but also meeting the high bar of consistency, completion, and usability metrics. Innovation. Sophistication. Optimization. This is our passion. Worldwide, the Volkswagen Group has a long tradition of dramatic innovations. The Volkswagen Group with its headquarters in Wolfsburg is one of the world’s leading automobile manufacturers and the largest car maker in Europe. The Group comprises of twelve brands from seven European countries: Volkswagen Passenger Cars, Audi, SEAT, ŠKODA, Bentley, Bugatti, Lamborghini, Porsche, Ducati, Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles, Scania and MAN.Here in the US, we are blending German engineering with American ingenuity. Our mission is to drive change which means we are not only impacting one of the world’s largest car makers, but also the lives of millions of people. Are you ready to join us?The UI Designer Sr position will be based in Santa Clara, CA, with a role classification of hybrid remote.Role SummaryThe UI Designer Senior will be responsible for leading design efforts to ensure that our Android-based OneInfotainment systems are usable, accessible, and enjoyable for our customers in North America.This role will be focused on design for in-car Android Automotive UI, not on mobile development. The ideal candidate will have strong UI design background, having worked on infotainment and in-car screens for automotive, and will be motivated by a strong human-centered design foundation.Role ResponsibilitiesUI Framework & Design Asset Development (80%) Works within a global multi-brand UI Design Systems & UX Framework to design the Infotainment & Comfort Experience for North American Users. Our In-Car Infotainment Applications are based on Android Automotive OS and designed to be skinned & deployed by multiple Brands of the VW Group. Works as part of an inter-disciplinary product team and creates various design artifacts to support a user-centered design process. Creates wireframes, specifications & design assets for product implementation. description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONThe AWS Analytics team designs and delivers the next generation suite of business analytics tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Amazon FinSpace, and AWS Glue Databrew. We empower technical and non-technical users in every industry with “low-code” and “no-code” analytics solutions. We constantly innovate ways to deliver faster, more intuitive, and more actionable insights at a massive scale. We are re-inventing business intelligence with the goal of allowing everyone to make data-driven decisions. Our customers include startups and Fortune 500 companies.To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Visual Designer to be the key voice in defining the brand identity and visual language of our enterprise-class application through UI, art direction, graphic design, and motion design.Key job responsibilitiesYou will be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers harness the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. You will have a significant impact on our business as you take a leadership role in setting the creative strategy for this new collection of products and services.You will also drive our creative strategy by working with key stakeholders to prioritize and maximize resources, scoping projects, and communicating trade-offs when appropriate. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, and design technologists who seek to harness the power of the AWS cloud into an everyday tool for data management, analysis and collaboration through a human-centered design process.A day in the lifeThe ideal candidate will thrive in collaboration with UX designers, product managers, marketing managers, and other visual designers to create and maintain a cohesive visual identity for our new service across all customer touch-points. You are a problem solver with strong bias for action, always ready to be hands-on to visualize solutions. You take a customer-centered approach to define how visual design works across contexts, devices and domains, while being able to dive deep into identity, layout, typography, UI, motion design, and other components of visual brand expression. You proactively work on behalf of the team to create clarity in the face of ambiguity.Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional experience as a UI designer or interaction designer, visual designer, creative director, art director, or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices. Experience working in a product lifecycle with front-end and back-end engineering teams. Estimate, organize, and track components within an atomic design system. Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in graphic design or related field or equivalent professional experience within a design fieldPreferred Qualifications Exceptional creative concepting, development, and design skills, Experience creating brand guidelines and UX design systems Deep understanding of typography, design principles, trends and best practices across enterprise software Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business and user interaction priorities A self-starter with the ability to navigate ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment An understanding of how to advocate for customers and integrate user research in the creative process Curiosity to dig several layers deep into success metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers Basic knowledge of UX and front-end web design processes and accessibility standardsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. As the Zeplin crew, we're building an app used by tens of thousands of product teams daily. While creating a common language for our fellow designers and developers, we care deeply about building a product that delights them.About The RoleOne of Zeplin's co-founders, Pelin, was our only Product Designer during the first 4 years and this puts us in a unique position—design is a core piece of Zeplin's culture. We've reached over 4 million users from thousands of product teams, including Airbnb, Dropbox, Pinterest, Microsoft, and many more in just six years. We're a Y Combinator startup backed by notable investors like Elad Gil, Mike Maples, Kevin Hale. We're a small, distributed crew with offices in San Francisco, Istanbul, and London, UK.Zeplin started as one piece of the product development cycle. And now designers and engineers interact at every point, from idea to production. Our goal is to help with all the issues that product teams might face in this process. About ClairIf you can send your friends money in seconds, why does it still take your employer two weeks to send your paycheck?At Clair, we are on a mission to create financial freedom for America's workers by giving them an app that allows them to get paid as soon as they clock out of work. But we're not just another digital bank or on-demand pay provider. We meet Americans at their place of work by embedding our products within the scheduling, workforce management, and payroll apps they already use every day. And, as a social impact fintech, our promise to our users is simple: we'll never charge our users to access the money they've already worked for.We welcome people who add a new set of experiences to our melting pot of backgrounds. We're 40-ish, spread across multiple states, hailing from various countries. We've got grandparents working alongside recent graduates, Americans partnering with immigrants, and self-taught coders debating with Ivy League graduates. We embrace diversity in all its forms.We are backed by investors who are not only well-renowned in their fields, but are also great partners for us. We've raised $19.5 million from Thrive Capital, Upfront Ventures, Founder Collective, and Walkabout VC, as well as many individual investors like Michael Vaughan (Former COO of Venmo) and Paul Appelbaum (Founder of Seamless).Learn more about us at getclair.com/aboutWhat will you do at Clair?As a Designer at Clair, you will be joining a small and quickly growing team of designers who are passionate about bringing financial security to underserved communities. Your work will be cross-functional and your impact will be felt across our company. Our product offering is still new and ripe for innovation - are you ready to take it to the next level with us?Some Of Your Specific Responsibilities Will IncludeDelivering design work including sketches, wireframes, prototypes, & high fidelity designs that all lead to a highly intuitive user experience.Running usability studies to test design ideas with our target audience.Designing high-quality, thoughtful interfaces that balance aesthetics and usability.Ensuring that brand and quality standards are met.Contributing to our growing design system.Building empathy for our users through close collaboration on user research.Taking ownership of your product area and being accountable for delivering work on-time.Articulating your design vision to cross-functional partners with exceptional clarity.Bringing knowledge about accessibility and the impact of inclusive design on a community.Effectively communicate with developers to implement and realize the design vision.Getting to know the world of finance technology (and making it better!)Who will succeed at Clair? Someone who….4+ years of experience in Product or UX Design. Can show a portfolio of mobile design case studies.Has worked in a start-up or high growth team and understands the importance of creating process and structure. Is familiar with design tools and technologies including Figma, Miro, Sketch and/or Jira. Asks thought-provoking questions before diving into execution.Thrives in a collaborative, diverse work environment.Takes pride in owning their work and delivers on schedule.Challenges themselves to pick up new skills and workflows.Understands UI/UX best practices.Wants to be in a hands-on designer role.Enjoys working in a fast and quickly-evolving environment.Is excited to have a social impact in their work.Can travel to NYC to collaborate with Product and Technology teams.Has US work authorization.Not sure you tick all the boxes? We encourage you to apply. We have a culture of learning, and if this job description sounds exciting, we’d love to hear from you.Need more convincing?BenefitsApart from getting to work with our incredible team, here are some of the benefits you can expect when you join Clair100% Medical, Dental, & Vision Coverage, with option to extend to your familyFully-paid parental leaveCompany-sponsored 401k, HSA, and FSATelehealth & medical concierge services with OneMedicalUnlimited vacation Work from home setup allowanceCitibike membership for NY-based employeesAccess to your earnings every day on Clair Company-sponsored short-term and long-term disability insuranceEqual Opportunity Employer InformationClair is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. Job TitleUI DesignerRequisition IDR013542Job DescriptionYour Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare.A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONThe AWS Analytics team designs and delivers the next generation suite of business analytics tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Amazon FinSpace, and AWS Glue Databrew. We empower technical and non-technical users in every industry with “low-code” and “no-code” analytics solutions. We constantly innovate ways to deliver faster, more intuitive, and more actionable insights at a massive scale. We are re-inventing business intelligence with the goal of allowing everyone to make data-driven decisions. Our customers include startups and Fortune 500 companies.To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Visual Designer to be the key voice in defining the brand identity and visual language of our enterprise-class application through UI, art direction, graphic design, and motion design.Key job responsibilitiesYou will be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers harness the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. You will have a significant impact on our business as you take a leadership role in setting the creative strategy for this new collection of products and services.You will also drive our creative strategy by working with key stakeholders to prioritize and maximize resources, scoping projects, and communicating trade-offs when appropriate. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, and design technologists who seek to harness the power of the AWS cloud into an everyday tool for data management, analysis and collaboration through a human-centered design process.A day in the lifeThe ideal candidate will thrive in collaboration with UX designers, product managers, marketing managers, and other visual designers to create and maintain a cohesive visual identity for our new service across all customer touch-points. You are a problem solver with strong bias for action, always ready to be hands-on to visualize solutions. You take a customer-centered approach to define how visual design works across contexts, devices and domains, while being able to dive deep into identity, layout, typography, UI, motion design, and other components of visual brand expression. You proactively work on behalf of the team to create clarity in the face of ambiguity.Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional experience as a UI designer or interaction designer, visual designer, creative director, art director, or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices. Experience working in a product lifecycle with front-end and back-end engineering teams. Estimate, organize, and track components within an atomic design system. Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in graphic design or related field or equivalent professional experience within a design fieldPreferred Qualifications Exceptional creative concepting, development, and design skills, Experience creating brand guidelines and UX design systems Deep understanding of typography, design principles, trends and best practices across enterprise software Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business and user interaction priorities A self-starter with the ability to navigate ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment An understanding of how to advocate for customers and integrate user research in the creative process Curiosity to dig several layers deep into success metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers Basic knowledge of UX and front-end web design processes and accessibility standardsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. You will consider the effects of typography, space, layouts, color illustrations and photography on the experience of and usability of products and services. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Starbucks, as a company is all about creating a culture of warmth and belonging, acting with courage, and delivering our very best. We are performance driven, through the lens of humanity. When you work with us, you hold Starbucks legacy. Our mission: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit - one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time. We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about user experience but embodies the Starbucks mission and values.Team DescriptionCome be a part of an innovative Digital Product Design team that believes in digging deeper to figure out how technology should work for our retail partners (employees). We’re looking for a User Experience Designer to join our human centered design team. We are a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by an iterative process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we’re discovering the needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for thousands of store partners.Role DescriptionYou are a driven UX Designer who appreciates simplicity and appealing user experiences.You are passionate about UI and Visual Design/Interaction Design.We have a few projects in the pipeline, and we are tackling our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. There are countless UX challenges and we feel like we are in a unique position to change the way our store partners (employees) interact with digital. You’ll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form the product. You’ll use your full range of skills in user experience to build great products.Responsibilities You're actively involved in defining product strategy. Thinking in terms of human centered design and making rational design decisions. Constantly pushing your limits and searching for opportunities to become better. Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled. You thrive in an environment with short feedback loops. You partner with other designers to elevate the group. You should be comfortable understanding how to do user research to validate your design ideas.Requirements 2+ years professional experience creating and walking stakeholders through user journeys, wires, prototypes, usability studies, and other design deliverables. An understanding of what makes an experience good or bad is critical. You can think through user problems, find reasonable solutions, mock them up in detail, and work with product managers and engineers to build them. You're a self-starter who actively seeks ways to make the Starbucks experience both visually appealing and easy to use. You look for opportunities to solve problems in unusual and innovative ways. You understand the technical limitations and liberties behind your decisions and have enough chops to communicate your ideas to our engineers and the rest of the team. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent practical work experience in User Experience.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com. job_title: Visual UX Designer, Amazon Pharmacy - Open to Virtual
description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONWe are seeking a Visual UX Designer to work on customer-facing digital experiences in Pharmacy. You will create elegant, intuitive user interfaces, illustrations, and creative direction that meet this unique customer need. You will work closely with other designers, product management, engineering, and other design teams to successfully go from early stage product concepts to launches of new features and experiences. You will extend and support the design system used by Pharmacy and other initiatives in Amazon's health portfolio.Key job responsibilities Maintain and extend the Pharmacy Design System Quickly iterate on multiple design explorations to arrive at fun and delightful solutions Work with the design team and our internal stakeholders to develop design concepts, gather information, discuss alternatives, gain approval, and review design specifications Fluency in moving from understanding and interpreting strategy to developing initial concepts. Create and rapidly iterate on ideas using storyboards, prototypes, and higher-fidelity designs to effectively communicate visual strategies and experiences Participate in the discovery and planning of new products and features while helping drive the design vision across our product suite. Work with other UX designers to ensure visual consistency and relentless attention to detail Identify opportunities to think differently about the visual status quo on customer experiences, based on customer research, best practices and design thinking Articulately present design vision, direction and solutions to senior leadership and internal stakeholdersAbout The TeamAt Amazon Pharmacy, we are using design, service, and technology to change the way people think about medicine. Design is a vital part of our company’s DNA — Amazon Pharmacy grew out of PillPack, which has been recognized by Time, Fast Company, and the Cooper Hewitt Museum of Design for our customer experience. You’ll have the opportunity to make a big impact on our customers’ lives while designing the future of pharmacy and contributing to our mission of building the earth’s most customer-centric pharmacy.Basic Qualifications 5+ years of relevant work experience Bachelors in graphic design, visual design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related field A portfolio of work demonstrating user interface design and design systems across multiple product categories, platforms, and domains.Preferred Qualifications Expert skill level with standard design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma, etc. Strong creative thinker with the ability and willingness to pivot approaches as required Demonstrated ability to learn, evaluate, and adopt new technologies quickly Ability to work with ambiguity and visualize solutions for emerging concepts Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization Exceptional attention to detail Experience with motion design Experience working in a start-up style environment, where rapid iteration is encouraged Experience designing products for global markets Experience with animatics, art direction, and illustrationThe pay range for this position in Colorado is $117,725 -$160,000/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionAt Bento (which is now a part of the U.S. Bank family), we believe there’s a better way for businesses to manage and control expenses. We genuinely care about people in everything we do, and we are dedicated to building the best possible products and experiences at every touchpoint for our customers.We are looking for a talented and passionate Visual UX designer who can thrive in a fast-paced environment and has a vast understanding of the end-to-end design process. You will enhance our user experience with an intuitive and friendly design based on analysis and creative patterns constructed to solve our customer’s needs. With your hands-on attitude, you'll work with the team through all parts of the design process, from concept development, design flows, interaction, and visual design, to final specs. You will work closely with the product and engineering teams to identify new improvement opportunities, implement innovative concepts, and create delightful new experiences.ResponsibilitiesDeeply understand our customers and users and be their championDesign seamless and intuitive user experiences across web and mobile interfaces Craft compelling sketches, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and mockupsCreate consistent and cohesive design patternsPartner closely with product and engineering and contribute to the product visionEffectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationaleBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience Three to five years of related work experience, such as UX or digital industryPreferred Skills/Experience/CompetenciesPrevious experience designing complex, multi-functional, large-scale applicationsStrong understanding of the modern web technology stackProficiency in industry UX/Visual design standards and prototyping tools such as Sketch, inVision, Photoshop, Figma, or equivalentStrong web & mobile design portfolio that showcases visual design and interaction design skillsDetail-oriented, user-centric mindset able to deconstruct complex issuesKnowledge of and ability to apply human behavior patterns for design recommendationsStoryteller with the ability to listen, present, and sell through empathetic visualsExperience transforming complex frames into simple flowsUnderstanding of information architecture, design patterns, and interaction designAbility to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, flows, ideas, rationale, and solutions to teams and stakeholdersExperience with receiving and implementing feedback and constructive criticism Familiar with tight deadlines, changing priorities, and multidisciplinary challengesAbility to stay up-to-date on best practices and industry trends in UX designExcellent interpersonal, written, and communication skillsUnderstands HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and other digital technologiesExperience creating style guides, pattern libraries, infographics, and iconographyFocused on research and data-driven recommendations Familiar with accessibility practicesProactive, goal-oriented individual who takes pride in what they doEntrepreneurial and intellectually curious people Interest in crafting intuitive banking experiences to solve real customer problemsProven experience designing for consumer-focused products in FinTech is a plusIf there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.BenefitsTake care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionResponsible for defining and executing visual communication strategies that tell the story of the work of the Service Design Strategy team. The Service Design Team helps teams understand the customer’s experiences and collaborates to design new experiences that meet customer’s needs. You will be an integral part of the team and will participate in the design process itself including: research, synthesis, opportunity definition, concept development and prototype development.Through your work you will be designing, shaping and improving the customer and employee experiences. You will consider the effects of typography, space, layouts, color illustrations and photography on the experience of and usability of products and services. You will also combine a thorough knowledge of current design trends, and a working knowledge of front-end development to interface across a variety of digital products.Responsibilities IncludeCreates Journey Maps, Concept Storyboards, Prototypes and other necessary visualsCreates other artifacts as needed to communicate the work of the Service Design TeamCreates accessible interaction modules, screen layouts, style guides, pattern libraries, images, icons and other visual elements for projectsApplies and updates existing brand (visual and interaction) standards to accommodate new products and campaignsPresents and communicates design and design goals to teammates and partnersValidates code is built as designed during projects (according to brand standards, style guides and pattern libraries)Reviews artifacts and deliverables from peer designers to ensure they accurately represent the U.S. Bank brandCollaboratively partners with internal peers (visual designers, content writers, accessibility consultants, researchers, prototypers, and strategists) to create world class customer experiencesFormally observes user interviews and usability sessions with the possibility of conducting interviews as wellBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience Three to five years of related work experience, such as UX or digital industryPreferred Skills/ExperienceThorough knowledge of and experience with UX best practices, service design process and framework, and experience in workshop and co-creationsThorough knowledge of website architecture, interactive design principles, web usability, and online marketing and business needsExperience with user-centered design from concept to deliveryExperience/familiarity with CSS and responsive designSkilled with design /interaction / transition / motion design (portfolio required)Experience creating style guides for development teamsExperience working in a cross-channel environment, including desktop/laptop, mobile, devices and brick-and-mortar locationsExperience collaborating with large teamsStrong communication and presentation skillsThorough knowledge of UX best practicesAbility to problem-solve and work independentlyIf there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.BenefitsTake care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. location: New York, New York, United States
description: This opportunity is to join McCann New York, the flagship office of the global McCann network, as a UI Designer primarily focused on digital projects across many of McCann’s clients. The UI designer will join a team responsible for producing digital and experiential advertising projects. You will partner closely with a UX architect in order to deliver conceptual and production quality user interfaces for both websites and occasionally brand experiences. Responsibilities:· Create conceptual and production quality User Interfaces and digital assets for web, be that components, full pages, user journeys, or entire websites.· Able to work across websites, apps, and interfaces within installations/activations which could vary across the UI/design spectrum.· Design, produce and detail UI assets ready for developer hand-off.· Work with UX consultants to ideate, conceptualize and feed into the UX strategy.· Support the digital team in the discovery phase of projects, assisting with identification of the creative and visual design strategy.· Champion digital creative excellence, upskilling the team and push the boundaries of creative output for the department.· Experience executing interfaces; working within the defined user experience and brand guidelines to fulfil strategic goals translating brand identity across digital touchpoints. About you:· You are highly collaborative and thrive on working in close partnerships with UX consultants and developers to design effective experiences but are equally comfortable working independently on multiple smaller projects.· You will have excellent communication skills visually, verbally and in written format enabling you to convey your design intentions and rationale, whether that be to internal account teams, or with clients.· Proven creative problem solver experienced in dealing with digital channel limitations and marketing requirements. · You will naturally have a high attention to detail with pixel perfect consistency a given, and technical design knowledge including typography, layout principles, mobile and UI best practice, asset optimization, and accessibility considerations.· You will have skills in Adobe Creative Suite and ideally Adobe XD, able to efficiently craft user interfaces, scalable design systems, and create low functional fidelity prototypes. Experience in Sketch, Figma, Axure, ProtoPie or other design and prototyping tools including HTML & CSS would be a bonus.· You will have an excellent UI portfolio that communicates the visual decision-making process you and your team arrived at in response to end user goals and business requirements.· You will be curious about understanding user behavior and the audience you design user interfaces for, with a genuine passion in developing your knowledge of usability and user experience.· You will have a strong interest in digital beyond the web and keep up to date with the latest advancements through active involvement in the design community.· 2+ years of experience as a UI Designer preferred McCann is an EEO M/F/Disability/Vet EmployerParticipant in E-Verify Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Temporary Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Advertising Services

Job TitleUI DesignerRequisition IDR013542Job DescriptionYour Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare.A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter.Your MissionAs a UI Designer you will participate in the creation and maintenance of a functioning, iterative UI pipeline, in collaboration with team members from other disciplines.ResponsibilitiesPriorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilitiesCreate UI layout, script functionality, and animation of UI features.Create and/or integrate assets and test functionality of UI widgets.Work closely with our UI/UX Director, UI Design Lead and other UI/UX Designers on implementing and scrutinizing UI components.Player Profile Experience3+ years developing for PC and console, as well as one shipped title is preferred.Knowledge & SkillsPassionate and knowledgeable about UI and UX, and able to articulate this.Experience with scripting languages (Lua, ActionScript, C#, Python, React JS).Must be proficient in Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator.Key AttributesPassion for games.Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.R013542 Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Computer Games

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionResponsible for defining and executing visual communication strategies that tell the story of the work of the Service Design Strategy team. The Service Design Team helps teams understand the customer’s experiences and collaborates to design new experiences that meet customer’s needs. You will be an integral part of the team and will participate in the design process itself including: research, synthesis, opportunity definition, concept development and prototype development.Through your work you will be designing, shaping and improving the customer and employee experiences. You will consider the effects of typography, space, layouts, color illustrations and photography on the experience of and usability of products and services. You will also combine a thorough knowledge of current design trends, and a working knowledge of front-end development to interface across a variety of digital products.Responsibilities IncludeCreates Journey Maps, Concept Storyboards, Prototypes and other necessary visualsCreates other artifacts as needed to communicate the work of the Service Design TeamCreates accessible interaction modules, screen layouts, style guides, pattern libraries, images, icons and other visual elements for projectsApplies and updates existing brand (visual and interaction) standards to accommodate new products and campaignsPresents and communicates design and design goals to teammates and partnersValidates code is built as designed during projects (according to brand standards, style guides and pattern libraries)Reviews artifacts and deliverables from peer designers to ensure they accurately represent the U.S. Bank brandCollaboratively partners with internal peers (visual designers, content writers, accessibility consultants, researchers, prototypers, and strategists) to create world class customer experiencesFormally observes user interviews and usability sessions with the possibility of conducting interviews as wellBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience Three to five years of related work experience, such as UX or digital industryPreferred Skills/ExperienceThorough knowledge of and experience with UX best practices, service design process and framework, and experience in workshop and co-creationsThorough knowledge of website architecture, interactive design principles, web usability, and online marketing and business needsExperience with user-centered design from concept to deliveryExperience/familiarity with CSS and responsive designSkilled with design /interaction / transition / motion design (portfolio required)Experience creating style guides for development teamsExperience working in a cross-channel environment, including desktop/laptop, mobile, devices and brick-and-mortar locationsExperience collaborating with large teamsStrong communication and presentation skillsThorough knowledge of UX best practicesAbility to problem-solve and work independentlyIf there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.BenefitsTake care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visiting usbank.com/careers.EEO is the LawApplicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal EEO is the Law poster.E-VerifyU.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories.
