Who are we?We are innovators combining machine learning and AI with human insight to reshape digital marketing. We champion big ideas, embrace cross-functional collaboration, and invite bold thinkers from all over the world to be a part of our teams. We bring passion to our roles, cultivate diverse perspectives, and never stop striving for powerful results. Informed by a decade of conversion data, our advertising conversion cloud creates personalized connections between brands and their customers. Like us, our technology is always in pursuit of better ways.If you are excited to be part of this vision, read on!About YouYou love your work, and you want to be a part of an extraordinary Team! You believe in having a diverse and inclusive culture that promotes equality for all. We’re looking to grow our Professional Services division by adding an UI Designer to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual to join a growth-stage organization and help pioneer the next generation of personalization technology. With this position you will get the opportunity to apply conversion oriented design principles to help deliver experiences that lead to results. You have a history of successfully working in a hybrid environment made up of remote workers who will stay 100% remote post covid and employees who will go back to the office three days a week once it’s safe.A day in the life… You will collaborate with copywriters, UX designers, conversion optimization strategists, client partners, and more You will define the visual direction of projects to shape and position ideas for customer impact You will review a steady stream of design work, ensuring it’s of the highest quality You will problem-solve process issues across multiple working groups You will provide occasional off-hours coverage for teammates across the company You will stay up-to-date on conversion-centric design trends and best practices You will familiarize yourself with the design guidelines and client needs of multiple clients You will work with a wide range of stakeholders to produce design solutions RequirementsWe would love to hear from you if this sounds like you… 3+ years experience with a track record of designing exceptional experiences for web and mobile pages Strong written and verbal English skills Proficient in popular design tools like the Adobe Suite, Sketch, Figma, and Creative Cloud Page optimization experience Previous work in Instapage platform is a plus Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver high-quality work under tight timelines Ability to work and manage multiple ongoing projects Ability to present and explain design decisions to diverse groups, including customers Next Steps!We are an equal opportunity employer searching for exceptional talent of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are here to support every candidate and provide reasonable accommodations to help you apply , if needed.If you’ve made it this far, we hope you’re as excited as we are about finding out if we’re a good fit for each other, let’s talk. You will build and be part of a world-class design and creative team dedicated to Superside employer marketing, and play a critical role in shaping our presence in the website but will also be involved with our digital communications.What You'll Do Craft our career area in our website with amazingly designed web page designs both for desktop and mobile, that are focused on improving the user experience and increasing lead conversions Create prototypes and UI mockups clearly illustrating website function and appearance. Translate wireframes and whiteboard sketches into high-fidelity mockups Contribute to the overall reach, engagement, and quality of the culture through creative design Work on simultaneous projects, involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish, execute with overview and pixel perfect detail, on time Be involved with bringing your work to life Report to Talent Design Lead, and collaborate with other designers, developers, and strategists from all over the world Continuously learn, develop, and grow yourself and othersWhat You'll Need to Know Degree in Design, Fine Arts, Engineering or related field A minimum of 5 years experience as a Web Designer or UX/UI Designer Excellent design competencies and a strong portfolio Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, and/or similar tools A solid understanding of UX/UI design principles Experience in building design systems is a plus Ability to quickly learn the process and multi-task projects with great detail Ability to always deliver with quality on time High level of knowledge and craft, providing top-notch design Experience in working with cross-functional teams Excellent English verbal and written communication skills Bias for action, hard-working, proactive and execution drivenWhy Join UsWe are a global company with 400+ subscription customers worldwide (Shopify, Coinbase, Amazon, etc.) and are experiencing strong revenue growth. You will be exposed to all aspects of a business in startup mode and scaling quicklyWe’re 100% distributed, so you can work from anywhere in the worldYour Account Development team is new priority for the organization’s growth, giving you the opportunity to build a successful program with career growth opportunities as you do.We value employee development; and offer mentorship, meaningful work and many opportunities to step up and leadSee something you want to improve? Awesome. We’re a flexible and collaborative team that is always learning and growingThe whole company is closely connected and aligned. We function in a trusting environment while seeking the truth in an ego-free mannerWe’re just the right size. Not a small startup and not a corporate entity eitherWe have a strong social mission. We currently deliver strategic design solutions to clients like Facebook, Redbull, Experian, Puma, Amazon, Salesforce, Cisco, LVMH, Twitch, Airbus, L'Oreal, Tiffany & Co. and more. We work together and with our clients through our inhouse design ops platform, enabling seamless and productive remote collaboration across the world. Superside is backed by Y Combinator, Slack Fund, Freestyle Capital and High Alpha Capital. We're a fully distributed team of ex tier one professionals located all around the world, spanning 50+ countries and 19 timezones. Design at Disney is at the forefront of creating intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that our fans love and crave. We strive to design high-quality end-to-end experiences while maintaining an inclusive and collaborative culture. To us, team-fit and attitude are as important as hard design skills.DMED Technology Design is the unified design org for 90+ customer-facing websites/apps and hundreds of enterprise products in the Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) Technology organization. We are the storytellers responsible for adding “something special” to our consumers’ experience every day through exciting design, artwork, branding and UX globally. We are responsible for driving the product design, user experiences, creative direction, production design, motion design, service design, UX copywriting, UX research and UX engineering. It is our job to create a framework that delivers consistent, creative and innovative user experiences for people – whether they are using Disney’s consumer-facing products, or the platforms, products and tools that help power our business. Crucially, how we do that work must be both imaginative and efficient, allowing us to also free our team devote energy to using design to drive innovation.The consumer portfolio we get to design for includes many of the most trusted and beloved brands in the world – ABC, ABC News, Disney, ESPN, Freeform, FX, Marvel, National Geographic and Star Wars. These are great products, and our charge is to always imagine ways to make them even better; to deliver happiness and magical moments through artistry and inventive design, reinforcing the emotional connection between consumers and Disney’s brands.The enterprise portfolio we are responsible for is also critically important – and our colleagues, partners and businesses will be relying upon us to bring the same kind of imagination, ease and consistent excellence to those experiences.The DMED Technology Platform Design team lays the foundation across Mobile, Desktop, and TV apps for our consumer experiences. This mission includes the continued development and proliferation of our design system framework and platform user experience teams, including streaming, discovery, editorial, identity, and commerce patterns and templates. Our StoryTrust is a fundamental part of humanity, but with the rise of the internet over the last couple of decades, we’ve seen a plethora of trust issues emerge like spam, fraudulent transactions, hate speech, and online abuse. Today, with AI, computers take on more tasks usually done by humans, with an increase in efficiency and productivity. However, We understand the implications of AI, and the potential danger of not having visibility into how it affects the real world. There is a lack of trust in AI outcomes because often AI models can be opaque. We started Fiddler because we believe there is a need for a new kind of Explainable AI Platform. One that enables organizations to get ahead of these issues by building trustworthy, transparent, and understandable AI solutions.Who We AreOur team is motivated by helping the world to unlock the AI blackbox. We help humans harness AI to create more understanding around results, create actionable insights, eliminate biases, and identify performance gaps. We know that AI is the future and believe that learning the “why” behind the results is crucial to any business or platform. We are still an early-stage startup, and are rapidly growing our team! This is an exciting time to join an XAI startup that is quickly becoming a leader in the space. Fiddler Labs is recognized as a pioneer in the field of Explainable AI, and has received numerous accolades, including: 100 most promising Technology Pioneers of 2020 by the World Economic Forum, Forbes 50 most promising AI startups, and a Cool Vendor in Gartner’s 2019 Cool Vendors in Enterprise AI Governance and Ethical Response report.We are looking for a UI Designer to join our growing team!What You'll DoContribute to a wide variety of designs in Figma- including interactive wireframes, pixel-perfect UI specifications, and graceful user-flowsCollaborate daily with peers across disciplines including engineering, product, and data scienceInterpret complex ideas and transform them into delightful and intuitive interfacesEmpathize with a diverse range of user personas across conflicting use-cases and technical proficienciesMaintain a comprehensive design library of reusable components in collaboration with front-end engineersEnhance the usability of product experiences across the platform with consideration of qualitative and quantitative dataWork with a design manager to articulate, prioritize, and execute design projectsGive and solicit actionable feedback in service of building the best productsWhat We Are Looking For2+ years of experience as a UI designer working on enterprise productsHighly skilled in carrying product features from brainstorming to wireframes to high-fidelity UI mockups1+ year using Figma with contributions to a design system featuring reusable components and clickable prototypesCoherent portfolio of software design projects, with enterprise projects preferred. Visually polished UI documents are required. Wireframes are not sufficientDemonstrated ability to evolve design elements to meet new product requirements, highly responsive to iterative product development cycleExperience working with front-end engineers through design handoff and negotiationDesign writing and communication experienceFiddler Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. 543052BRIntroductionThomas J. Watson said it best: “Good design is good business.” Visualization is critical to discovering data-driven insights and effectively communicating that knowledge to others. Designers at IBM work to create experiences that work together, work the same, and work for our clients. Does the thought of creating the platform at the heart of solutions like Watson, Blockchain, IoT, and Security excite you? If so, read on!Your Role and ResponsibilitiesAt Turbonomic, an IBM company, we deliver a best-in-class automation platform that helps customers safely free capacity, both human and budget, to focus on IT innovation. Turbonomic’s Application Resource Management (ARM) platform continuously assures that the full application stack has precisely the right resources needed to perform, while maintaining policy compliance and eliminating overspending.Today’s IT organizations are under tremendous pressure to deliver applications and services faster with greater efficiency. At Turbonomic, we believe these IT organizations cannot meet the needs of their business with a collection of “tools” that produce information for humans to consume and humans to use. IT Operations must transform by adopting a full-stack automation platform that can assure the performance of any application in any environment: Turbonomic. Join our team and help us transform IT!User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. As a UX Designer you will partner closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Researchers and, most importantly, our customers to design a product that delights our users as it guides them to fundamentally change how they run their IT organizations.We are seeking out a proactive, self-motivated designer who is willing to challenge the status quo. You will work with customers at huge Fortune 500 companies who leverage our software assure application performance every day. Your focus will be to design new, and improve existing features based on user research and analytics data. Another key area is to own our Design System by updating and adding new components.Required Technical and Professional ExpertiseExpert in UI design.Solid UX design (including research and testing) skills.Some experience with creating and managing Design Systems.Familiar with UX writing.Experienced in developing high fidelity end to end designs in Sketch, creating a cohesive experience, leveraging a centralized design system.Basic understanding of responsive web design: HTML, CSS, etc.Experience with working in cross functional roles with Product Management, Development and QAAbility to articulate and demonstrate design value.Present and articulate design process, inspiration, and decisions to internal stakeholders including C-suite executives.Some experience with BI, performance analysis, and recommendation systems.Preferred Technical And Professional ExpertiseExperience working with distributed or remote teams.Practitioner of product-led growth techniques.Familiar with doing research and design within iterative development.Familiarity with basic concepts of computer science and the modern IT industry.About Business UnitIBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.Your Life @ IBMAre you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.It's time to define your career.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.Location StatementBenefitsIn addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access toIBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work.12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).Select educational reimbursement opportunities.Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionResponsible for defining and executing visual communication strategies that tell the story of the work of the Service Design Strategy team. The Service Design Team helps teams understand the customer’s experiences and collaborates to design new experiences that meet customer’s needs. You will be an integral part of the team and will participate in the design process itself including: research, synthesis, opportunity definition, concept development and prototype development.Through your work you will be designing, shaping and improving the customer and employee experiences. You will consider the effects of typography, space, layouts, color illustrations and photography on the experience of and usability of products and services. You will also combine a thorough knowledge of current design trends, and a working knowledge of front-end development to interface across a variety of digital products.Responsibilities IncludeCreates Journey Maps, Concept Storyboards, Prototypes and other necessary visualsCreates other artifacts as needed to communicate the work of the Service Design TeamCreates accessible interaction modules, screen layouts, style guides, pattern libraries, images, icons and other visual elements for projectsApplies and updates existing brand (visual and interaction) standards to accommodate new products and campaignsPresents and communicates design and design goals to teammates and partnersValidates code is built as designed during projects (according to brand standards, style guides and pattern libraries)Reviews artifacts and deliverables from peer designers to ensure they accurately represent the U.S. Bank brandCollaboratively partners with internal peers (visual designers, content writers, accessibility consultants, researchers, prototypers, and strategists) to create world class customer experiencesFormally observes user interviews and usability sessions with the possibility of conducting interviews as wellBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience Three to five years of related work experience, such as UX or digital industryPreferred Skills/ExperienceThorough knowledge of and experience with UX best practices, service design process and framework, and experience in workshop and co-creationsThorough knowledge of website architecture, interactive design principles, web usability, and online marketing and business needsExperience with user-centered design from concept to deliveryExperience/familiarity with CSS and responsive designSkilled with design /interaction / transition / motion design (portfolio required)Experience creating style guides for development teamsExperience working in a cross-channel environment, including desktop/laptop, mobile, devices and brick-and-mortar locationsExperience collaborating with large teamsStrong communication and presentation skillsThorough knowledge of UX best practicesAbility to problem-solve and work independentlyIf there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.BenefitsTake care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visiting usbank.com/careers.EEO is the LawApplicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal EEO is the Law poster.E-VerifyU.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.Due to legal requirements, U.S. Bank requires that the successful candidate hired for some positions be fully-vaccinated for COVID-19, absent being granted an accommodation due to a medical condition, pregnancy, or sincerely held religious belief or other legally required exemption. For these positions, as part of the conditional offer of employment, the successful candidate will be asked to provide proof of vaccination or approval for an accommodation or exemption upon hire. Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONCome be a part of the mission to improve children’s lifelong outcomes by helping them connect with adult loved ones, no matter how near or far. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet.Description of Glow: “A new-to-world virtual, connected, and projected interaction model designed to help children and remote loved ones play, create, read, learn and have fun together as if they are right next to each other.”#GlowCareersWe are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. As an Art Director, you will be working with a collaborative team developing exciting products for consumers.Key job responsibilitiesThis position requires the ability to dive deep, invent, and be relentlessly curious about customer needs and how we can bring potential solutions to life. You will validate concepts at a variety of fidelities, including working prototypes, throughout the design process. You are highly motivated to explore new opportunities along the way, consistently raising the bar for what’s possible. You will be hands-on, designing graphics and UI elements, executing creative direction, establishing procedure, and ensuring visual consistency across our product. Create and rapidly iterate on ideas using storyboards, prototypes, and higher-fidelity designs to effectively communicate visual strategies and experiences Articulately present design vision, direction and solutions to senior leadership and internal stakeholders Fluency in moving from understanding and interpreting strategy to developing initial concepts Participate in the discovery and planning of new products and features while helping drive the design vision across our product suite Work with other UX designers to ensure visual consistency and relentless attention to detail Identify opportunities to think differently about the visual status quo on customer experiences, based on customer research, best practices and design thinkingAbout The TeamWe are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded designers and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Basic Qualifications 4+ years of relevant work experience Bachelors in graphic design, visual design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related field A portfolio of work demonstrating user interface design and design systems across multiple product categories, platforms, and domains. Expert level with standard design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc.Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated ability to learn, evaluate, and adopt new technologies quickly Ability to work with ambiguity and visualize solutions for emerging concepts Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization Exceptional attention to detail Experience designing interfaces for interactive mobile experiences Experience with illustration and motion design Experience working in a start-up style environment, where rapid iteration is encouraged Experience designing products for global markets Experience designing consumer products for children and familiesAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A1911804 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

location: New York, New York, United States
description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONThe AWS Analytics team designs and delivers the next generation suite of business analytics tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Amazon FinSpace, and AWS Glue Databrew. We empower technical and non-technical users in every industry with “low-code” and “no-code” analytics solutions. We constantly innovate ways to deliver faster, more intuitive, and more actionable insights at a massive scale. We are re-inventing business intelligence with the goal of allowing everyone to make data-driven decisions. Our customers include startups and Fortune 500 companies.To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Visual Designer to be the key voice in defining the brand identity and visual language of our enterprise-class application through UI, art direction, graphic design, and motion design.Key job responsibilitiesYou will be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers harness the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. You will have a significant impact on our business as you take a leadership role in setting the creative strategy for this new collection of products and services.You will also drive our creative strategy by working with key stakeholders to prioritize and maximize resources, scoping projects, and communicating trade-offs when appropriate. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, and design technologists who seek to harness the power of the AWS cloud into an everyday tool for data management, analysis and collaboration through a human-centered design process.A day in the lifeThe ideal candidate will thrive in collaboration with UX designers, product managers, marketing managers, and other visual designers to create and maintain a cohesive visual identity for our new service across all customer touch-points. You are a problem solver with strong bias for action, always ready to be hands-on to visualize solutions. You take a customer-centered approach to define how visual design works across contexts, devices and domains, while being able to dive deep into identity, layout, typography, UI, motion design, and other components of visual brand expression. You proactively work on behalf of the team to create clarity in the face of ambiguity.Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional experience as a UI designer or interaction designer, visual designer, creative director, art director, or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices. Experience working in a product lifecycle with front-end and back-end engineering teams. Estimate, organize, and track components within an atomic design system. Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in graphic design or related field or equivalent professional experience within a design fieldPreferred Qualifications Exceptional creative concepting, development, and design skills, Experience creating brand guidelines and UX design systems Deep understanding of typography, design principles, trends and best practices across enterprise software Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business and user interaction priorities A self-starter with the ability to navigate ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment An understanding of how to advocate for customers and integrate user research in the creative process Curiosity to dig several layers deep into success metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers Basic knowledge of UX and front-end web design processes and accessibility standardsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon Dev Center U.S., Inc.Job ID: A1905213 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

Direct message the job poster from Portfolio Creative Jamie Wells Business Development Manager at Portfolio Creative ABOUT OUR CLIENT:Award-winning creative studio based proudly in downtown Columbus, Ohio.Founders started the company in 2011 on the belief that a smaller, focused team can deliver a more powerful consumer-first, branded experience than most, larger shops.MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS:• 3-5 years of design experience, preferably in interactive/digital• Bachelor's Degree in Design (or a killer portfolio and some serious design-savvy)• Be the lead designer on projects and lead design teams when necessary• Produce concepts from sketch to beautiful and effective digital designs• It is your responsibility to work alongside and help lead 2nd concept designers• You are expected to see website re-designs all the way through A-Z, concept to QA• Create best practice information architecture; sitemaps, wireframes & user flows• Must have the ability to clearly articulate UX/UI reviews internally and to clients• Follow creative direction and client brand guidelines to establish brand language and extension• Collaborate with developers, copywriters, producers, other designers, and interns• Prepare files for print production, HTML, emails, social assets and style guidesBONUS SKILLS:• Motion graphics using After Effects, Cinema 4D, Lottie Files• Photography and Photo editing experience• Video editing experience using Premiere or Final Cut Pro• Illustration using your hands• Javascript or CSS animation experiencePERKS AND BENEFITS:• Health, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance (99% premium paid by the company, 1% paid by employee)• Long-Term Disability (100% premium paid by the company)• 401k with company matching and profit sharing• PTO with holidays + studio shut down at end of year• 4-week sabbatical after your 6th year• Hybrid schedule (WFH Monday / Friday, in studio Tuesday - Thursday)• Macbook Pros on tap• Training + conference opportunities• Casual dog-friendly studio environment• Downtown studio with parking paid for by the company• Summer hours on Fridays (as long as it's warm out and the brews are cold)• Full fridge of impromptu Happy Hour beverages• Catered lunches on Wednesday from Bentos Catering• Coffee roasted by One Line CoffeeVIEW MORE HERE:https://jobs.portfoliocreative.com/jobs/5896 Show more Show less Employment type Full-time

Direct message the job poster from Adecco Shlomo Vidal Staffing, Music & Technology, Good Conversations, Great Career Opportunities The Adecco Creative & Marketing team is currently looking for a UX/UI (heavy on the UI) designer for a Leading Educational Publishing Company! The position is fully remote as well as project based so it will easily fit into your schedule! If you're interested please apply to this post with a resume and a portfolio including webpage design. We are looking to move forward with candidates quickly so if you're looking for something immediate, this is a perfect role for you.RequirementsAdvanced skills with Adobe XDExperience in exporting XD to HTML (bonus if you are able to adapt/troubleshoot for responsiveness)ProjectsLanding Page XD Files.For this project, we would be looking for someone to create XD files based on our style guide and existing components. We are looking for someone who is skilled with XD and can create organized, clean, intuitive files that a designer could use to mix and match the components to create the layout they need as various Landing Page needs arise. Ideally, these files would cleanly export to HTML.Modifications to pages on our current website, already in productionThere are various child pages that need some attention. I would provide in-progress XD files along with feedback. Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONCome be a part of the mission to improve children’s lifelong outcomes by helping them connect with adult loved ones, no matter how near or far. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet.Description of Glow: “A new-to-world virtual, connected, and projected interaction model designed to help children and remote loved ones play, create, read, learn and have fun together as if they are right next to each other.”#GlowCareersWe are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology and to solve real-world problems that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. As an Art Director, you will be working with a collaborative team developing exciting products for consumers.Key job responsibilitiesThis position requires the ability to dive deep, invent, and be relentlessly curious about customer needs and how we can bring potential solutions to life. You will validate concepts at a variety of fidelities, including working prototypes, throughout the design process. You are highly motivated to explore new opportunities along the way, consistently raising the bar for what’s possible. You will be hands-on, designing graphics and UI elements, executing creative direction, establishing procedure, and ensuring visual consistency across our product. Create and rapidly iterate on ideas using storyboards, prototypes, and higher-fidelity designs to effectively communicate visual strategies and experiences Articulately present design vision, direction and solutions to senior leadership and internal stakeholders Fluency in moving from understanding and interpreting strategy to developing initial concepts Participate in the discovery and planning of new products and features while helping drive the design vision across our product suite Work with other UX designers to ensure visual consistency and relentless attention to detail Identify opportunities to think differently about the visual status quo on customer experiences, based on customer research, best practices and design thinkingAbout The TeamWe are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded designers and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Basic Qualifications 4+ years of relevant work experience Bachelors in graphic design, visual design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related field A portfolio of work demonstrating user interface design and design systems across multiple product categories, platforms, and domains. Expert level with standard design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma, etc.Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated ability to learn, evaluate, and adopt new technologies quickly Ability to work with ambiguity and visualize solutions for emerging concepts Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization Exceptional attention to detail Experience designing interfaces for interactive mobile experiences Experience with illustration and motion design Experience working in a start-up style environment, where rapid iteration is encouraged Experience designing products for global markets Experience designing consumer products for children and familiesAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A1911804 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

Starbucks, as a company is all about creating a culture of warmth and belonging, acting with courage, and delivering our very best. We are performance driven, through the lens of humanity. When you work with us, you hold Starbucks legacy. Our mission: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit - one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time. We are looking for someone who is not only passionate about user experience but embodies the Starbucks mission and values.Team DescriptionCome be a part of an innovative Digital Product Design team that believes in digging deeper to figure out how technology should work for our retail partners (employees). We’re looking for a User Experience Designer to join our human centered design team. We are a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by an iterative process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we’re discovering the needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for thousands of store partners.Role DescriptionYou are a driven UX Designer who appreciates simplicity and appealing user experiences.You are passionate about UI and Visual Design/Interaction Design.We have a few projects in the pipeline, and we are tackling our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. There are countless UX challenges and we feel like we are in a unique position to change the way our store partners (employees) interact with digital. You’ll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form the product. You’ll use your full range of skills in user experience to build great products.Responsibilities You're actively involved in defining product strategy. Thinking in terms of human centered design and making rational design decisions. Constantly pushing your limits and searching for opportunities to become better. Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled. You thrive in an environment with short feedback loops. You partner with other designers to elevate the group. You should be comfortable understanding how to do user research to validate your design ideas.Requirements 2+ years professional experience creating and walking stakeholders through user journeys, wires, prototypes, usability studies, and other design deliverables. An understanding of what makes an experience good or bad is critical. You can think through user problems, find reasonable solutions, mock them up in detail, and work with product managers and engineers to build them. You're a self-starter who actively seeks ways to make the Starbucks experience both visually appealing and easy to use. You look for opportunities to solve problems in unusual and innovative ways. You understand the technical limitations and liberties behind your decisions and have enough chops to communicate your ideas to our engineers and the rest of the team. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent practical work experience in User Experience.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com. Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Information Technology and Engineering Industries Food and Beverage Services, Manufacturing, and Retail

With your hands-on attitude, you'll work with the team through all parts of the design process, from concept development, design flows, interaction, and visual design, to final specs. location: New York, New York, United States
description: This opportunity is to join McCann New York, the flagship office of the global McCann network, as a UI Designer primarily focused on digital projects across many of McCann’s clients. The UI designer will join a team responsible for producing digital and experiential advertising projects. You will partner closely with a UX architect in order to deliver conceptual and production quality user interfaces for both websites and occasionally brand experiences. Responsibilities:· Create conceptual and production quality User Interfaces and digital assets for web, be that components, full pages, user journeys, or entire websites.· Able to work across websites, apps, and interfaces within installations/activations which could vary across the UI/design spectrum.· Design, produce and detail UI assets ready for developer hand-off.· Work with UX consultants to ideate, conceptualize and feed into the UX strategy.· Support the digital team in the discovery phase of projects, assisting with identification of the creative and visual design strategy.· Champion digital creative excellence, upskilling the team and push the boundaries of creative output for the department.· Experience executing interfaces; working within the defined user experience and brand guidelines to fulfil strategic goals translating brand identity across digital touchpoints. About you:· You are highly collaborative and thrive on working in close partnerships with UX consultants and developers to design effective experiences but are equally comfortable working independently on multiple smaller projects.· You will have excellent communication skills visually, verbally and in written format enabling you to convey your design intentions and rationale, whether that be to internal account teams, or with clients.· Proven creative problem solver experienced in dealing with digital channel limitations and marketing requirements. · You will naturally have a high attention to detail with pixel perfect consistency a given, and technical design knowledge including typography, layout principles, mobile and UI best practice, asset optimization, and accessibility considerations.· You will have skills in Adobe Creative Suite and ideally Adobe XD, able to efficiently craft user interfaces, scalable design systems, and create low functional fidelity prototypes. Experience in Sketch, Figma, Axure, ProtoPie or other design and prototyping tools including HTML & CSS would be a bonus.· You will have an excellent UI portfolio that communicates the visual decision-making process you and your team arrived at in response to end user goals and business requirements.· You will be curious about understanding user behavior and the audience you design user interfaces for, with a genuine passion in developing your knowledge of usability and user experience.· You will have a strong interest in digital beyond the web and keep up to date with the latest advancements through active involvement in the design community.· 2+ years of experience as a UI Designer preferred McCann is an EEO M/F/Disability/Vet EmployerParticipant in E-Verify Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Temporary Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Advertising Services

We are partnering with deel for our hiring process. Please make sure your country is supported by deel before applying.CompensationSalary is dependent on your experience and we are open to cash, equity, or a combination.About PractivestPractivest, a FinTech startup focused on disrupting the traditional investment industry, looking for a highly energetic creative designer to streamline its user flow through our web application. Job TitleUI DesignerRequisition IDR013542Job DescriptionYour Platform Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades. Some of our previous titles include: Call of Duty®: Ghosts, Call of Duty®: Infinite Warfare and most recently, Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare.A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at https://www.infinityward.com/, on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/InfinityWard/, and @InfinityWard on Twitter.Your MissionAs a UI Designer you will participate in the creation and maintenance of a functioning, iterative UI pipeline, in collaboration with team members from other disciplines.ResponsibilitiesPriorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilitiesCreate UI layout, script functionality, and animation of UI features.Create and/or integrate assets and test functionality of UI widgets.Work closely with our UI/UX Director, UI Design Lead and other UI/UX Designers on implementing and scrutinizing UI components.Player Profile Experience3+ years developing for PC and console, as well as one shipped title is preferred.Knowledge & SkillsPassionate and knowledgeable about UI and UX, and able to articulate this.Experience with scripting languages (Lua, ActionScript, C#, Python, React JS).Must be proficient in Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator.Key AttributesPassion for games.Our World Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.Activision Blizzard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.R013542 Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Design, Art/Creative, and Information Technology Industries Computer Games

Who are we?We are innovators combining machine learning and AI with human insight to reshape digital marketing. We champion big ideas, embrace cross-functional collaboration, and invite bold thinkers from all over the world to be a part of our teams. We bring passion to our roles, cultivate diverse perspectives, and never stop striving for powerful results. Informed by a decade of conversion data, our advertising conversion cloud creates personalized connections between brands and their customers. Like us, our technology is always in pursuit of better ways.If you are excited to be part of this vision, read on!About YouYou love your work, and you want to be a part of an extraordinary Team! You believe in having a diverse and inclusive culture that promotes equality for all. We’re looking to grow our Professional Services division by adding an UI Designer to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual to join a growth-stage organization and help pioneer the next generation of personalization technology. With this position you will get the opportunity to apply conversion oriented design principles to help deliver experiences that lead to results. You have a history of successfully working in a hybrid environment made up of remote workers who will stay 100% remote post covid and employees who will go back to the office three days a week once it’s safe.A day in the life… You will collaborate with copywriters, UX designers, conversion optimization strategists, client partners, and more You will define the visual direction of projects to shape and position ideas for customer impact You will review a steady stream of design work, ensuring it’s of the highest quality You will problem-solve process issues across multiple working groups You will provide occasional off-hours coverage for teammates across the company You will stay up-to-date on conversion-centric design trends and best practices You will familiarize yourself with the design guidelines and client needs of multiple clients You will work with a wide range of stakeholders to produce design solutions RequirementsWe would love to hear from you if this sounds like you… 3+ years experience with a track record of designing exceptional experiences for web and mobile pages Strong written and verbal English skills Proficient in popular design tools like the Adobe Suite, Sketch, Figma, and Creative Cloud Page optimization experience Previous work in Instapage platform is a plus Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver high-quality work under tight timelines Ability to work and manage multiple ongoing projects Ability to present and explain design decisions to diverse groups, including customers Next Steps!We are an equal opportunity employer searching for exceptional talent of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are here to support every candidate and provide reasonable accommodations to help you apply , if needed.If you’ve made it this far, we hope you’re as excited as we are about finding out if we’re a good fit for each other, let’s talk. location: New York, New York, United States
description: WMG's top priority is the safety and wellbeing of its team members, artists and songwriters across the globe. In response to COVID-19, WMG is fully committed to helping its people balance their home and life commitments with flexible working options, virtual wellness sessions, and more. WMG strives to maintain a COVID-free workplace. To that end, being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment for all US new employees, prior to the commencement of employment. If you are hired, you will be required to provide proof of your vaccination as part of your new employee onboarding process, subject to our legal obligation to make reasonable accommodations in certain limited circumstances.Job Description At Warner Music Group we’re all about our people. Our global company is made up of knowledgeable, passionate, and creative individuals. Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We believe in each individual’s value and encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity. It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music – at every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart by embracing innovation – an integral part of our company's DNA. Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the most influential forces in culture today. Job Title: Junior Product DesignerA Little Bit About Our TeamThe User Experience Team at Warner Music Group is a small and focused band of experts. We support each other to get complex work done right. We’re looking for a Junior Product Designer to help transpose, invert, and augment the music business, crafting world-class experiences that connect artists and their music to your eyes & ears. You will wear all the hats, leading the UX of projects for artists, managers, and internal teams, collaborating with product managers, stakeholders, and developers while discovering, researching, defining, designing, and prototyping.Here You’ll Get To Design premium, modern, end-to-end user-centric experiences Help define new user interface (UI) components and augment the style guide User and comparator research through focus groups, interviews, surveys, and analytics Study early requirements and transform them into scenarios, personas, use cases, flow diagrams, site maps, inventories, interactive (IA), sketches, wireframes, and prototypes Follow brand guidelines and transform them into visual and component designs, interactions, data visualization, and testable prototypes Work in an Agile environment with Project Managers and Developers to shape epics & stories in JIRA, inspect code, and execute visual quality assurance (QA)About You Pixel-perfect user experiences and interfaces to be implemented within a product Iterative creation of sketches and pitch-quality design/interaction concepts & prototypes Diligence in developing responsive designs that work across platforms (e.g. web, tablet, mobile) Experience working with style guides and user experience (UX) libraries, common patterns, and current UX practices) Partnering with senior designers in developing and building an enterprise style & component platform Contribution across multiple projects at one time Strong communication skills, excellent time management & organizational skills High-Level Proficiency in Figma At least 3 years of product and/or UX design experience in the industry Experience with prototyping/animation tools, e.g. Figmotion, Adobe XD, Principle, AfterEffects, etc. Music industry experience Formal training in Graphic Design (BFA preferred)About UsWith its broad and diverse roster of new stars and legendary artists, Warner Music Group is home to a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, East West, Elektra, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics and Warner Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers with a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide.For more than four decades, WMG has been an industry-leading force in providing a world-class array of services designed to help artists and labels grow their careers and their businesses. Artist & Label Services is the umbrella for WEA (Warner-Elektra-Atlantic) – the pioneering WEA distribution and marketing network – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels. Love this job and want to apply? Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. description: Job SummaryDESCRIPTIONThe AWS Analytics team designs and delivers the next generation suite of business analytics tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Amazon FinSpace, and AWS Glue Databrew. We empower technical and non-technical users in every industry with “low-code” and “no-code” analytics solutions. We constantly innovate ways to deliver faster, more intuitive, and more actionable insights at a massive scale. We are re-inventing business intelligence with the goal of allowing everyone to make data-driven decisions. Our customers include startups and Fortune 500 companies.To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Visual Designer to be the key voice in defining the brand identity and visual language of our enterprise-class application through UI, art direction, graphic design, and motion design.Key job responsibilitiesYou will be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers harness the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. You will have a significant impact on our business as you take a leadership role in setting the creative strategy for this new collection of products and services.You will also drive our creative strategy by working with key stakeholders to prioritize and maximize resources, scoping projects, and communicating trade-offs when appropriate. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, and design technologists who seek to harness the power of the AWS cloud into an everyday tool for data management, analysis and collaboration through a human-centered design process.A day in the lifeThe ideal candidate will thrive in collaboration with UX designers, product managers, marketing managers, and other visual designers to create and maintain a cohesive visual identity for our new service across all customer touch-points. You are a problem solver with strong bias for action, always ready to be hands-on to visualize solutions. You take a customer-centered approach to define how visual design works across contexts, devices and domains, while being able to dive deep into identity, layout, typography, UI, motion design, and other components of visual brand expression. You proactively work on behalf of the team to create clarity in the face of ambiguity.Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional experience as a UI designer or interaction designer, visual designer, creative director, art director, or similar role An online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices. Experience working in a product lifecycle with front-end and back-end engineering teams. Estimate, organize, and track components within an atomic design system. Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in graphic design or related field or equivalent professional experience within a design fieldPreferred Qualifications Exceptional creative concepting, development, and design skills, Experience creating brand guidelines and UX design systems Deep understanding of typography, design principles, trends and best practices across enterprise software Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Relentless desire for innovation, balanced with business and user interaction priorities A self-starter with the ability to navigate ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment An understanding of how to advocate for customers and integrate user research in the creative process Curiosity to dig several layers deep into success metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers Basic knowledge of UX and front-end web design processes and accessibility standardsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Company - Amazon Dev Center U.S., Inc.Job ID: A1905213 Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Art/Creative and Design Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing

Direct message the job poster from Portfolio Creative Jamie Wells Business Development Manager at Portfolio Creative ABOUT OUR CLIENT:Award-winning creative studio based proudly in downtown Columbus, Ohio.Founders started the company in 2011 on the belief that a smaller, focused team can deliver a more powerful consumer-first, branded experience than most, larger shops.MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS:• 3-5 years of design experience, preferably in interactive/digital• Bachelor's Degree in Design (or a killer portfolio and some serious design-savvy)• Be the lead designer on projects and lead design teams when necessary• Produce concepts from sketch to beautiful and effective digital designs• It is your responsibility to work alongside and help lead 2nd concept designers• You are expected to see website re-designs all the way through A-Z, concept to QA• Create best practice information architecture; sitemaps, wireframes & user flows• Must have the ability to clearly articulate UX/UI reviews internally and to clients• Follow creative direction and client brand guidelines to establish brand language and extension• Collaborate with developers, copywriters, producers, other designers, and interns• Prepare files for print production, HTML, emails, social assets and style guidesBONUS SKILLS:• Motion graphics using After Effects, Cinema 4D, Lottie Files• Photography and Photo editing experience• Video editing experience using Premiere or Final Cut Pro• Illustration using your hands• Javascript or CSS animation experiencePERKS AND BENEFITS:• Health, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance (99% premium paid by the company, 1% paid by employee)• Long-Term Disability (100% premium paid by the company)• 401k with company matching and profit sharing• PTO with holidays + studio shut down at end of year• 4-week sabbatical after your 6th year• Hybrid schedule (WFH Monday / Friday, in studio Tuesday - Thursday)• Macbook Pros on tap• Training + conference opportunities• Casual dog-friendly studio environment• Downtown studio with parking paid for by the company• Summer hours on Fridays (as long as it's warm out and the brews are cold)• Full fridge of impromptu Happy Hour beverages• Catered lunches on Wednesday from Bentos Catering• Coffee roasted by One Line CoffeeVIEW MORE HERE:https://jobs.portfoliocreative.com/jobs/5896 Show more Show less Employment type Full-time

Direct message the job poster from Adecco Shlomo Vidal Staffing, Music & Technology, Good Conversations, Great Career Opportunities The Adecco Creative & Marketing team is currently looking for a UX/UI (heavy on the UI) designer for a Leading Educational Publishing Company! The position is fully remote as well as project based so it will easily fit into your schedule! If you're interested please apply to this post with a resume and a portfolio including webpage design. We are looking to move forward with candidates quickly so if you're looking for something immediate, this is a perfect role for you.RequirementsAdvanced skills with Adobe XDExperience in exporting XD to HTML (bonus if you are able to adapt/troubleshoot for responsiveness)ProjectsLanding Page XD Files.For this project, we would be looking for someone to create XD files based on our style guide and existing components. We are looking for someone who is skilled with XD and can create organized, clean, intuitive files that a designer could use to mix and match the components to create the layout they need as various Landing Page needs arise. Ideally, these files would cleanly export to HTML.Modifications to pages on our current website, already in productionThere are various child pages that need some attention. I would provide in-progress XD files along with feedback. At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.Job DescriptionResponsible for defining and executing visual communication strategies that tell the story of the work of the Service Design Strategy team. The Service Design Team helps teams understand the customer’s experiences and collaborates to design new experiences that meet customer’s needs. You will be an integral part of the team and will participate in the design process itself including: research, synthesis, opportunity definition, concept development and prototype development.Through your work you will be designing, shaping and improving the customer and employee experiences. You will consider the effects of typography, space, layouts, color illustrations and photography on the experience of and usability of products and services. You will also combine a thorough knowledge of current design trends, and a working knowledge of front-end development to interface across a variety of digital products.Responsibilities IncludeCreates Journey Maps, Concept Storyboards, Prototypes and other necessary visualsCreates other artifacts as needed to communicate the work of the Service Design TeamCreates accessible interaction modules, screen layouts, style guides, pattern libraries, images, icons and other visual elements for projectsApplies and updates existing brand (visual and interaction) standards to accommodate new products and campaignsPresents and communicates design and design goals to teammates and partnersValidates code is built as designed during projects (according to brand standards, style guides and pattern libraries)Reviews artifacts and deliverables from peer designers to ensure they accurately represent the U.S. Bank brandCollaboratively partners with internal peers (visual designers, content writers, accessibility consultants, researchers, prototypers, and strategists) to create world class customer experiencesFormally observes user interviews and usability sessions with the possibility of conducting interviews as wellBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience Three to five years of related work experience, such as UX or digital industryPreferred Skills/ExperienceThorough knowledge of and experience with UX best practices, service design process and framework, and experience in workshop and co-creationsThorough knowledge of website architecture, interactive design principles, web usability, and online marketing and business needsExperience with user-centered design from concept to deliveryExperience/familiarity with CSS and responsive designSkilled with design /interaction / transition / motion design (portfolio required)Experience creating style guides for development teamsExperience working in a cross-channel environment, including desktop/laptop, mobile, devices and brick-and-mortar locationsExperience collaborating with large teamsStrong communication and presentation skillsThorough knowledge of UX best practicesAbility to problem-solve and work independentlyIf there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.BenefitsTake care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visiting usbank.com/careers.EEO is the LawApplicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal EEO is the Law poster.E-VerifyU.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. For these positions, as part of the conditional offer of employment, the successful candidate will be asked to provide proof of vaccination or approval for an accommodation or exemption upon hire.
